intro: Campanula pseudolanceolata subsp. semiamplexicaulis, commonly known as the semi-amplexicaulis bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features lanceolate leaves that are semi-amplexicaul, meaning they partially clasping the stem. The plant produces blue to violet bell-shaped flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
